course_title: Topics in Somatic Practices: Bartenieff Fundamentals
class_notes:
You must have permission to enroll in-person.
This course merges Bartenieff Fundamentals, developed by Irmgard Bartenieff, with Body-Mind Centering, developed by Bonnie Bainbridge Cohen, through movement practices. Students will discover the relationship between mobility and stability by exploring movement within the systems of the body, and through reflexes and equilibrium responses. Students will gain an in-depth understanding of developmental patterns that support movement's complexity. This material is useful in fields of dance, education, pre-med, pre-health, and psychology.
course_description: Somatic movement education builds a relationship between the body and mind by guiding the mover through a process of full body integration. A variety of somatic practices may be covered, including Bartenieff Fundamentals, Iyengar-based yoga, and Gyrokinesis movement training. Somatic practices can be applied to everyday activities and performance, affecting levels of confidence and encouraging authenticity.
